question_text: An administrator wants multiple subdomains (chat, ftp, www) to all resolve to the same server. What is the most efficient DNS configuration to allow this while only needing to update one IP address?
answer_options: Create separate A records for each subdomain
Create CNAME records pointing to a single A record
Create a single TXT record with multiple names
Use multiple MX records with equal priority
correct_answer: Create CNAME records pointing to a single A record
explanation: CNAMEs allow multiple domain names to resolve to a single canonical name, which can be backed by one A record.
